title: Re: Do you ever eat rocks?
content:
??? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

Where is the option 'yes'?

Rock candy ROCKS!!!

I LOVE EATING ROCKS.

I did, once, eat some granite.

It helps with indigestion, though... my tummy got scraped up, and it hurt. I'm lucky it all got our of me.

So I vote 'Yes', despite the fact that Harvey is too incompitent to put that option.

title: Re: Do you ever eat rocks?
content:
Rocks I have eaten:

I have consumed several types of clay [yes they are rocks]; mostly attached to food I've wrapped in clay and roasted on a bonfire.

Talc Very soft stuff, clams the stomach and is a good source of magnesium.

Sand, both willingly and accidentally.

Slate, I was curious.

Powdered basalt, I was curious.

Pumice stone, in toothpaste.

Glass, in toothpaste.


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Do you ever eat rocks?
content:

[quote]Quote:[hr]Glass, in toothpaste.[hr][/quote]

Those too, and sand ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] )

Yup, clay to... it's really a rock?!

Salt... if i remember correctly, it is a rock - And thus this poll becomes pointless!!! If you have not eaten salt... that you live boring lives

title: Re: Do you ever eat rocks?
content:
Its iron suphide; you can eat it, but more than a few grams will cause iron poisioning.

When powdered it explodes, crushed it burns when ignited.

It smells like burning matches.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
